measured_by: single-item mood self-report slider ('How have you felt this morning?')
justification: "How have you felt this morning?' (mood)… participants placed a cursor…along a horizontal continuous-scale"

measured_by: single-item sleep quality self-report slider ('How did you sleep last night?')
justification: The questionnaire asked: "How did you sleep last night?" … answered by moving the cursor on the same continuous scale

measured_by: single-item food enjoyment self-report slider ('How did you enjoy your last meal/snack?')
justification: Participants reported "How did you enjoy your last meal/snack?" using the horizontal continuous-scale with emoji end-points

measured_by: single-item stress self-report slider ('How did you feel about your personal and working problems?')
justification: The stress question "How did you feel about your personal and working problems this morning/afternoon?" was answered with the same cursor-based scale

measured_by: proportion of opt-out responses in the visual discrimination task
justification: "We inferred the level of self-confidence by tracking how often subjects chose an opt-out option…"

measured_by: median reaction time in correct non-opt-out trials
justification: "We also used median reaction times in a session as another indicator of the participant's confidence"

measured_by: difference between proportion of opt-out responses in stochastic vs deterministic stages
justification: "We used the difference between the proportion of opt-out responses in the DO and SO stages in a single session as a direct index of risk aversion"

measured_by: SDT-based distance between participant and optimal decision boundaries
justification: "We define an overconfidence metrics…based on the relationship of the estimated inter-boundary distance to the optimal inter-boundary distance"
